family.title: Family
family.description: Manage family members and their personal goals, diet, allergies and therapeutic model.
family.noMembers: No family members yet. Add yourself or a household member.
family.name: Name
family.nameDescription: Display name for this family member.
family.markAsSelf: This is me (default for meal plan)
family.deleteConfirmDescription: All personal settings (diet, allergies, therapeutic model) for this member will be permanently deleted.
family.generalDescription: Name and whether this family member is you.
family.dietAndPreferencesDescription: Allergies, calorie goal and meal preferences for this family member.
family.therapeuticDescription: Health data and therapeutic protocol for this family member.
family.familyDietDescription: One diet for the whole household; otherwise cooking is not feasible. Set allergies and preferences per family member below.
family.familyDietTypeDescription: The diet used to generate the meal plan.
family.familyDietIsInflamedDescription: With therapeutic protocols, nightshades can be excluded.
family.familyDietInSettings: The family diet is set on the family page below.

dashboard.title: Family intake overview
dashboard.description: Overview of macros, micros, supplements, minerals and trace elements per family member for the past week. Data is not yet connected.
dashboard.staticNotice: This is a static overview with sample data. Real intake will be connected later, after the calendar allows indicating per family member whether they deviated from the meal plan.

family.familyPracticalDescription: Cooking preferences and default number of portions for the whole household.
family.familyMaxPrepHelp: Only suggest recipes that can be prepared within this time.
family.familyServingsHelp: The default number of portions per meal.
family.familyGoalsDescription: Preferences for variety and strictness of the family diet.
family.familyStrictnessFlexibleDesc: An exception now and then is fine
family.familyStrictnessStrictDesc: Stick strictly to the chosen diet
family.familyPreferencesOnFamilyPage: Practical preferences (prep time, portions) and goals (variation, strictness) are set on the family page.
family.familyKcalTargetHelp: Leave empty if you don't have a specific calorie goal.
family.familyMealPreferencesDescription: Breakfast, lunch and dinner preferences (Enter to add).

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Manage your application preferences and settings
settings.scheduleDescription: Shopping day and how many hours in advance the meal plan should be ready.
settings.familyDietDescription: One diet for the whole household; otherwise cooking is not feasible. Set allergies and preferences per family member under Family.
settings.familyDietTypeDescription: The diet used to generate the meal plan.
settings.familyDietIsInflamedDescription: With therapeutic protocols, nightshades can be excluded.
settings.passwordDescription: Change your password to keep your account secure. Use at least 6 characters.
settings.adminSuccess: You now have admin rights! Refresh the page to see admin features.
settings.shoppingDayDescription: Day you do your grocery shopping
settings.leadTimeDescription: How many hours before shopping day the meal plan is ready
settings.favoriteMealIdsDescription: Choose favorites; they appear more often in your meal plan.
settings.requestAdminDescription: Make yourself admin (only possible if there are no admins yet).
settings.deleteAccountDescription: Permanently delete your account and all associated data.
settings.householdAvoidDescription: Hard rules can block recipes when applying draft. Add allergies or ingredients to avoid.
settings.householdAvoidStrictnessWarningNote: For type Warning, Soft is always used.
settings.servingsDescription: Set for how many people you cook and how servings are handled in meal plans.
settings.servingsHouseholdSizeDescription: Number of people (1–12) the meal plan is scaled for.
settings.servingsPolicyDescription: Scale recipes to household size or use recipe servings as-is.
settings.mealSlotStyleDescription: Set your default preference per meal slot; meal plans will align with these.
settings.mealSlotStyleBreakfastDescription: Default breakfast type (e.g. shake or eggs).
settings.mealSlotStyleLunchDescription: Default lunch type (e.g. salad or smoothie).
settings.mealSlotStyleDinnerDescription: Default dinner type (e.g. quick or family).
settings.weekendDinnerDescription: Set a different dinner preference for weekend days (Sat/Sun).
settings.validationMinOneDay: Select at least one weekend day.
settings.therapeuticProfileDescription: Health data and choice of a therapeutic protocol (e.g. MS). The meal planner uses these guidelines.

recipeImport.warningRestingTimeNotIncluded: Resting time is not included in total time
recipeImport.addAnotherPage: Recipe spans multiple pages? Add the next page here.
recipeImport.errorMaxPages: Maximum 5 pages. Remove a page to add another.
recipeImport.textImportPlaceholder: Paste recipe text here (from a website, app, or notes). It will be analyzed and converted into a recipe.
recipeImport.textImportHint: Minimum 10 characters. Ingredients and steps will be detected automatically.
recipeImport.textImportMinLength: Enter at least 10 characters to recognize a recipe.
recipeImport.textImportError: The text could not be recognized as a recipe. Try again or add manually.
recipeImport.fromScratchDescription: No source? Type preparation instructions and add ingredients yourself.
recipeImport.fromScratchError: The recipe could not be created. Please try again.

mealPlanner.shakeSmoothieGuidance:
MEAL TYPE GUIDANCE – Protein shake / Smoothie (HARD – food safety):
- A "protein shake" or "smoothie" is a blended DRINK, not a single ingredient.
- FORBIDDEN: NEVER use egg (raw or cooked) in a shake or smoothie. No chicken egg, fried egg, boiled egg – raw egg is unsafe, cooked egg does not belong in a drink. ALWAYS use yoghurt, milk, quark or protein powder as the protein source.
- ALWAYS use multiple ingredients (at least 3–4): a liquid base (milk, almond milk, soya milk, yoghurt, quark), fruit (banana, blueberries, strawberries, etc.) and a protein source (yoghurt, quark, or protein powder – NEVER egg).
- Good examples: milk + banana + yoghurt + blueberries; almond milk + protein powder + banana; quark + milk + berries.

therapeuticProtocols.name: Therapeutic protocols
therapeuticProtocols.description: Manage therapeutic protocols (active/inactive). Only active protocols are visible to users.
therapeuticProtocols.pageDescription: Manage protocols and set them active or inactive. Only active protocols are visible to users.

therapeuticAdh.pageDescription: Manage reference values for %ADH → absolute targets. Only active rows are used by the calculator.
